intro: Burmeistera ceratocarpa, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are often hairy. Burmeistera ceratocarpa is valued in gardens for its ornamental flowers and ability to attract pollinators.
